relation: The clear and encrypted keywords replaced the 0 and 7 keywords, and the hmac-md5 , text , and send-only keywords were added.
The keychain keychain-name keyword and argument were added.
Separated the hello-password keychain command as a separate command from the hello-password command, and updated the syntax of the hello-password command.
pageTitle: Cisco IOS XR Routing Command Reference for the Cisco CRS Router, Release 4.2.x - IS-IS Commands on Cisco IOS XR Software [Cisco Carrier Routing System] - Cisco
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {59429=For detailed information about IS-IS concepts, configuration tasks, and examples, see the Implementing IS-IS on Cisco ASR 9000 Series Router Cisco IOS XR Software module in the Cisco IOS XR Routing Configuration Guide for the Cisco XR 12000 Series RouterCisco IOS XR Routing Configuration Guide for the Cisco CRS RouterCisco ASR 9000 Series Aggregation Services Router Routing Configuration Guide.}
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {853659=(Optional) Specifies that the output be restricted to the last number of entries. Range is 1 to 1000., 336382=Under normal conditions, the default MTU size should be sufficient. However, if the MTU size of a link is less than 1500 bytes, the LSP MTU size must be lowered accordingly on each router in the network. If this action is not taken, routing becomes unpredictable., 854093=(Optional) Specifies that the output be restricted to the first number of entries. Range is 1 to 1000., 397416=seconds : 1200 seconds (20 minutes), 338865=The following example shows how to set the MTU size to 1300 bytes:, 167741=Advertised hold time in IS-IS hello packets is set to the hello multiplier times the hello interval. Range is 3 to 1000. Neighbors declare an adjacency to this down router after not having received any IS-IS hello packets during the advertised hold time. The hold time (and thus the hello multiplier and the hello interval) can be set on an individual interface basis, and can be different between different networking devices in one area., 412647=See RFC 2973 for details about the mesh group specification., 1053571=The topology keyword was added for multicast spf-log on the Cisco XR 12000 Series Router.}
textBeforeTable: Syntax Description { unicast | multicast } { ipv4 | ipv6 } address-family no { unicast | multicast } { ipv4 | ipv6 } address-family To enter address family configuration mode for configuring Intermediate System-to-Intermediate System (IS-IS) routing that use standard IP Version 4 (IPv4) and IP Version 6 (IPv6) address prefixes, use the address-family command in router configuration or interface configuration mode. To disable support for an address family, use the no form of this command. address-family (IS-IS) trace (IS-IS) topology-id tag (IS-IS) suppressed summary-prefix (IS-IS) spf prefix-priority (IS-IS) spf-interval snmp-server traps isis single-topology shutdown (IS-IS) show protocols (IS-IS) show isis topology show isis statistics show isis spf-log show isis route show isis protocol show isis neighbors show isis mpls traffic-eng tunnel show isis mpls traffic-eng advertisements show isis mpls traffic-eng adjacency-log show isis mesh-group show isis lsp-log show isis interface show isis hostname show isis fast-reroute show isis
textAfterTable: An address family is not specified. The default subaddress family (SAFI) is unicast. Command Modes Router configuration Interface configuration Command History Release Modification Release 3.7.2 This command was introduced. Release 3.9.0 Support for IPv6 was added. Command History Release Modification Release 2.0 This command was introduced. Release 3.4.0 The multicast keyword was added. Command History Release Modification
